summary: This is an email chain from August 25, 2020, between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and a contact in the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding access to documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which are stored in the West Palm Beach office. The New York team is prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell and seeks to review and scan these materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as the person currently being prosecuted by the team from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators; his case files are among the materials stored in West Palm Beach.

connections.description: The document references the prior SDFL investigation into 'Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators,' and the New York team prosecuting Maxwell is seeking those files, implying their alleged connection.

events.title: Coordination for document review
events.description: Email correspondence to arrange a call and access to documents from the prior SDFL Epstein investigation stored in West Palm Beach for the ongoing Maxwell prosecution.

events.title: Prior OPR inquiry document scanning
events.description: Reference to a past event where the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was on-site, used a dedicated scanner to scan documents from the Epstein materials, and sent them directly to DOJ accounts.

locations: West Palm Beach Regional Office â€” SDFL
U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell) was actively seeking access to documents from the prior Southern District of Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in August 2020.
The sought-after Epstein case files and materials from an OPR inquiry were physically stored in a secure room on the second floor of the West Palm Beach Regional Office.
There were existing inventories of these materials held by both the SDFL office and the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR).
The email chain shows procedural coordination between different U.S. Attorney's Offices regarding evidence sharing for the Maxwell prosecution.
